WRITING.TITLE: Touch launch is the most fun I've had playing games in years
WRITING.TEXT:
Most of the time good new games that come out are more impressive than they are fun. I can count on AAA titles each year to have a slightly higher resolution with flashier effects, bigger online battles, an open world with a larger draw distance, quality of life improvements, etc. But at the end of the day gameplay won't have evolved much. Generally speaking, I'm satisfied to pick up a game like Titanfall 2 that remixes and innovates on the fps genre while having some of the best graphics I've seen, but the truth is... I'm playing it using two thumbsticks as I have since the first Halo. All the rest isn't much more than window dressing.
I was severely disappointed in the initial Oculus Rift launch as someone who was hyped through the roof about it for months and months. I think a lot of people here would agree it was botched as fuck in terms of their communication with us, but the bottom line was none of those games were compelling to me. I was impressed, sure, to be able to step into the VR world for the first time, but the gameplay on something like Chronos seemed liked it was right out of a game I would skip ordinarily (and I love Zelda and Dark Souls). Eve: Valkyrie was badass for about five minutes until the lack of depth and menu clunkiness set in, not to mention the motion sickness I'd get. But first person cockpit VR was at least a type of gameplay I hadn't experienced before.
Well, I'd considered the whole thing a bust for the last six months, though I'd been enjoying the gaming pc I built specifically for this. I knew Touch was coming out, so I preordered, but I had basically zero expectations after feeling let down. I figured there was a solid chance I would sell the Rift + Touch once I had the complete package.
But holy f*** wtf goddamn - I can't even tell you how much fun I've been having the last couple of days. This is the real launch. This is why many of us believed virtual reality was the future.
My friends and I have been passing the headset around and just can't get the smiles off our faces. I can't remember anything like it. Closest thing would be Christmas morning when I got Super Mario 64 and could run around in the three dimensions for the first time. We are playing games like Rec Room and laughing our asses off as we do things that we never thought we'd do. For fucks sake, we have team deathmatch paintball, and it feels like I am in another place with people from around the world. This is a free game somehow, and one I wasn't even aware of a week ago. The amount of pure joy that goes along with dominating Rec Room dodgeball - I don't know that I've felt it before. It's all too natural to break out in a victory dance.
Super Hot is an example of me not believing my eyes. I wasn't ready for this. I can't believe it's real. It's probably too good. I just never thought I'd be having this experience, and it already feels so perfect. To think how things will only improve.
All the Touch games I've tried - Rec Room, Super Hot, Dead and Buried, The Unspoken, Bullet Train, I Expect You to Die, Quill, Medium - have been more than impressive, they've been compelling and most of all fun fun fun. They represent a paradigm shift that gaming hasn't had in over a decade.
Watching old videos, it seems he got a lot of respect throughout the 80s and 90s as a perfect example of success.

WRITING.TITLE: Exactly when did Donald Trump become a joke to most people?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

WRITING.TITLE: What's something you stopped doing after people made fun of you?
How do I calculate the IV of a level 1 (10 CP) Pokemon without powering it up?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm working on putting together my Bubblestrat squad, and I've got a lvl 1 Magnemite with Spark that can successfully take down my lvl 1 Tentacool with Bubble. However, according to https://pokemongo.gamepress.gg/bubblestrat-possibilities, which I found on The Silph Road subreddit, if Tentacool has a 0 stamina IV, it can be powered up to 1.5, thus pitting a 10 cp against a 20 cp and earning me more prestige and xp per attempt. No calculators that I use are able to give me a definitive answer on its IV without requiring me to power it up. Thoughts?

WRITING.TITLE: How do I calculate the IV of a level 1 (10 CP) Pokemon without powering it up?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
